Data Module¶

This section covers the PolyglotMol Data module, including classes and functions for input parsing, molecule representation, dataset management, and overview reporting.

  • Dataset overview Utilities API (polyglotmol.data.overview)
  • Dataset overview Utilities API (polyglotmol.data.overview)
  • Dataset overview Utilities API (polyglotmol.data.overview)
  • Dataset overview Utilities API (polyglotmol.data.overview)

Module Hierarchy¶

Basic input/output utilities and type definitions for PolyglotMol.

This module primarily defines the InputType enum used throughout the package and provides minimal shared utilities. Actual file parsing is handled by the respective Molecule and ProteinData classes.

class polyglotmol.data.io.InputType(value)[source]¶

Bases: Enum

Enumeration of possible molecular and protein input types.

This enum is used throughout PolyglotMol to identify data formats.

SMILES = 1¶
RDKIT_MOL = 2¶
MOLBLOCK = 3¶
SDF_FILE = 4¶
MOL_FILE = 5¶
MOL2_FILE = 6¶
PDB_FILE = 7¶
PYBEL_MOL = 8¶
MOLECULE = 9¶
SEQUENCE = 10¶
FASTA_STRING = 11¶
FASTA_FILE = 12¶
CIF_FILE = 13¶
PDB_ID = 14¶
ALPHAFOLD_ID = 15¶
UNIPROT_ID = 16¶
BIOPYTHON_STRUCTURE = 17¶
BIOPYTHON_SEQRECORD = 18¶
PROTEIN_DATA = 19¶
FILE_PATH = 20¶
UNKNOWN = 21¶
polyglotmol.data.io.guess_file_type(filepath: str | Path) → InputType | None[source]¶

Guess the InputType based on file extension.

Parameters:

filepath – Path to file

Returns:

Guessed InputType or None if cannot determine

Check if an InputType is protein-specific.

Parameters:

input_type – InputType to check

Returns:

True if protein-specific, False otherwise

polyglotmol.data.io.is_molecule_input_type(input_type: InputType) → bool[source]¶

Check if an InputType is small molecule-specific.

Parameters:

input_type – InputType to check

Returns:

True if molecule-specific, False otherwise

polyglotmol.data.io.mol_from_input(data: Any, input_type: InputType | None = None, **kwargs) → Any[source]¶

Parse molecular input and return RDKit Mol.

This is a compatibility wrapper that returns an RDKit Mol from various inputs.

Parameters:

  • data – Input data

  • input_type – Optional InputType hint

  • **kwargs – Additional options passed to Molecule.from_input()

Returns:

RDKit Mol object or None

polyglotmol.data.io.protein_from_input(data: Any, input_type: InputType | None = None) → str[source]¶

Convert protein input to sequence string.

This is a compatibility wrapper that extracts sequence from Protein.

Parameters:

  • data – Input data

  • input_type – Optional InputType hint

Returns:

Protein sequence string

Defines the Molecule class for representing and handling individual molecular structures. Includes all molecule-specific file parsing functionality.

class polyglotmol.data.molecule.Molecule(input_data: Any, input_type: InputType, id: Any | None = None, properties: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, source_path: str | Path | None = None, sanitize: bool = True, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Represents a single molecule, handling various input formats and providing access to different molecular representations.

This class encapsulates all molecule-specific file parsing and format conversion functionality.

__init__(input_data: Any, input_type: InputType, id: Any | None = None, properties: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, source_path: str | Path | None = None, sanitize: bool = True, **kwargs)[source]¶

Initialize a Molecule object.

Parameters:

  • input_data – The molecular data (SMILES, RDKit Mol, file path, etc.)

  • input_type – The type of input_data

  • id – Optional unique identifier. If None, a UUID is generated

  • properties – Optional dictionary of molecular properties

  • source_path – Optional path to source file

  • sanitize – Whether to apply RDKit sanitization (default: True)

  • **kwargs – Additional options for future compatibility

classmethod from_input(data: Any, input_type: InputType | None = None, sanitize: bool = True, addHs: bool = False, embed3d: bool = False, **kwargs) → Molecule | None[source]¶

Create a Molecule from various input formats.

This is the main entry point for creating Molecule objects from different data sources.

Parameters:

  • data – Input data (SMILES, file path, RDKit Mol, etc.)

  • input_type – Optional InputType hint

  • sanitize – Apply RDKit sanitization (default: True)

  • addHs – Add explicit hydrogens (default: False)

  • embed3d – Generate 3D coordinates (default: False)

  • **kwargs – Additional options

Returns:

Molecule object or None if parsing fails

Examples

>>> # From SMILES
>>> mol = Molecule.from_input("CCO")
>>>
>>> # From file
>>> mol = Molecule.from_input("/path/to/molecule.sdf")
>>>
>>> # With 3D coordinates
>>> mol = Molecule.from_input("CCO", embed3d=True)

Defines the MolecularDataset class for managing collections of molecules and features. Uses pandas DataFrames for storing labels, features, and weights.

class polyglotmol.data.dataset.MolecularDataset(molecules: Sequence[Molecule], ids: Sequence[Any] | None = None, labels: DataFrame | None = None, features: DataFrame | None = None, weights: DataFrame | None = None, metadata: Dict[str, Any] | None = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Manages a collection of molecules and their associated data (properties, features, weights).

__init__(molecules: Sequence[Molecule], ids: Sequence[Any] | None = None, labels: DataFrame | None = None, features: DataFrame | None = None, weights: DataFrame | None = None, metadata: Dict[str, Any] | None = None)[source]¶

Initializes the MolecularDataset.

Parameters:

  • molecules – List of Molecule objects to include in the dataset

  • ids – Optional list of IDs for the molecules (must be same length as molecules) If not provided, molecule.id will be used

  • labels – Optional DataFrame of labels with index matching molecule IDs

  • features – Optional DataFrame of features with index matching molecule IDs

  • weights – Optional DataFrame of sample weights with index matching molecule IDs

  • metadata – Optional dictionary of dataset-level metadata

property ids: Index¶

Returns the index (IDs) of the dataset.

property molecules: List[Molecule]¶

Returns the list of Molecule objects in the dataset.

property labels: DataFrame¶

Returns the DataFrame of labels.

property features: DataFrame¶

Returns the DataFrame of features.

property weights: DataFrame¶

Returns the DataFrame of sample weights.

property feature_names: List[str]¶

Returns the list of feature column names.

property label_names: List[str]¶

Returns a sorted list of unique top-level label names.

property weight_names: List[str]¶

Returns the list of weight column names.

get_features(names: str | List[str] | None = None) → DataFrame[source]¶

Returns a DataFrame containing the specified features.

Parameters:

names – Feature name(s) to retrieve. If None, returns all features.

Returns:

DataFrame containing the requested features.

Raises:

  • KeyError – If any requested feature name is not found.

  • TypeError – If names is not None, a string, or a list of strings.

get_labels(names: str | List[str] | None = None, include_errors: bool = False) → DataFrame[source]¶

Returns a DataFrame containing the specified labels. If include_errors is True, also includes associated error columns if available.

Parameters:

  • names – Label name(s) to retrieve. If None, returns all labels.

  • include_errors – If True, includes error columns for the selected labels if available.

Returns:

DataFrame containing the requested labels (and optionally their errors).

Raises:

  • KeyError – If any requested label name is not found.

  • TypeError – If names is not None, a string, or a list of strings.

get_weights(names: str | List[str] | None = None) → DataFrame[source]¶

Returns a DataFrame containing the specified weights.

Parameters:

names – Weight column name(s) to retrieve. If None, returns all weights.

Returns:

DataFrame containing the requested weights.

Raises:

  • KeyError – If any requested weight name is not found.

  • TypeError – If names is not None, a string, or a list of strings.

get_molecule(index_or_id: Any) → Molecule[source]¶

Retrieves a Molecule object by index position or ID.

Parameters:

index_or_id – Either a 0-based integer index or a molecule ID

Returns:

The requested Molecule object

Raises:

  • KeyError – If the ID is not found in the dataset.

  • IndexError – If the index is out of bounds.

  • TypeError – If the index_or_id is of an invalid type.

add_features(featurizer_inputs: str | BaseFeaturizer | List[str | BaseFeaturizer], feature_names: str | List[str] | None = None, n_workers: int = 1, on_error: str = 'store_none', featurizer_kwargs: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, mol_parser_kwargs: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, use_cache: bool | None = None, force_recompute: bool = False, overwrite: str = 'warn')[source]¶

Calculates features using one or more featurizers and adds them to the dataset.

Parameters:

  • featurizer_inputs – Featurizer instance(s) or registered name(s)

  • feature_names – Optional custom name(s) for the feature column(s)

  • n_workers – Number of parallel workers (1 for serial processing)

  • on_error – Error handling strategy: ‘store_none’, ‘raise’, or ‘remove’

  • featurizer_kwargs – Optional keyword args to pass to the featurizer.featurize method

  • mol_parser_kwargs – Optional keyword args for molecule parsing (e.g., sanitize)

  • use_cache – Whether to use caching (None=auto, True=force, False=disable)

  • force_recompute – If True, recompute even if cached representation exists

  • overwrite – Behavior when features already exist: ‘warn’, ‘skip’, ‘silent’, or ‘error’

get_featurization_failures(feature_name: str) → Dict[Any, Exception][source]¶

Returns a dictionary of featurization failures for a specific feature.

Parameters:

feature_name – Name of the feature set to get failures for

Returns:

Dictionary mapping molecule IDs to Exception objects

drop_featurization_failures(feature_name: str)[source]¶

Removes molecules that failed featurization for a specific feature set.

Parameters:

feature_name – Name of the feature set to remove failures for

concatenate_features(feature_names: List[str], new_feature_name: str, axis: int = 1, on_error: str = 'nan', fill_value=nan)[source]¶

Concatenates multiple feature arrays into a single feature.

Parameters:

  • feature_names – List of feature names to concatenate

  • new_feature_name – Name for the new concatenated feature

  • axis – Axis for concatenation (0=vertical, 1=horizontal)

  • on_error – Error handling strategy (‘nan’, ‘raise’, ‘skip_molecule’)

  • fill_value – Value to use for filling NaN arrays

itersamples() → Iterable[Tuple[Any, Molecule, Dict[str, Any], Dict[str, Any], Dict[str, Any]]][source]¶

Iterates over all samples in the dataset, yielding tuples of (molecule_id, molecule_object, labels_dict, features_dict, weights_dict).

Yields:

Tuple containing (ID, Molecule, labels dict, features dict, weights dict)

classmethod from_smiles_list(smiles_list: Sequence[str], ids: Sequence[Any] | None = None, properties_list: Sequence[Dict[str, Any]] | None = None, metadata: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, **mol_kwargs) → MolecularDataset[source]¶

Creates a dataset from a list of SMILES strings.

Parameters:

  • smiles_list – List of SMILES strings

  • ids – Optional list of IDs for the molecules (must match length of smiles_list)

  • properties_list – Optional list of property dictionaries (must match length of smiles_list)

  • metadata – Optional dataset-level metadata

  • **mol_kwargs – Additional keyword args passed to Molecule constructor

Returns:

MolecularDataset object

classmethod from_df(df: DataFrame, input_column: str, id_column: str | None = None, label_columns: List[str] | None = None, label_error_map: Dict[str, str] | None = None, label_error_suffix: str | None = None, weight_columns: List[str] | None = None, mol_input_type: InputType | None = None, metadata: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, dual_molecule_mode: bool = False, secondary_input_column: str | None = None, secondary_input_type: InputType | None = None, id_factory: Callable[[Dict[str, Any]], Any] | None = None, **mol_kwargs) → MolecularDataset[source]¶

Creates a dataset from a pandas DataFrame containing molecular data.

Parameters:

  • df – pandas DataFrame containing the molecular data

  • input_column – Name of the column containing molecular input data

  • id_column – Optional name of the column to use for molecule IDs

  • label_columns – Optional list of column names to use as labels

  • label_error_map – Optional dictionary mapping label columns to their error columns

  • label_error_suffix – Optional suffix for automatic detection of error columns (e.g., “-stderr”)

  • weight_columns – Optional list of column names to use as sample weights

  • mol_input_type – Type of molecular input in the input_column (default: SMILES)

  • metadata – Optional dataset-level metadata

  • dual_molecule_mode – If True, enables reading both primary and secondary input types

  • secondary_input_column – Column name for secondary molecular input data

  • secondary_input_type – Input type for secondary molecular data

  • id_factory – Optional function to generate unique IDs from row data

  • **mol_kwargs – Additional keyword args passed to Molecule constructor

Returns:

MolecularDataset object

Examples

>>> # Basic usage with SMILES and single label
>>> dataset = MolecularDataset.from_df(
...     df=df,
...     input_column='SMILES',
...     label_columns=['solubility']
... )

>>> # With error columns using suffix detection
>>> dataset = MolecularDataset.from_df(
...     df=endo_df,
...     input_column='SMILES',
...     label_columns=['Bx'],
...     label_error_suffix='-stderr'  # Will find 'Bx-stderr' automatically
... )

>>> # Multiple labels with explicit error mapping
>>> dataset = MolecularDataset.from_df(
...     df=df,
...     input_column='SMILES',
...     label_columns=['4T1', 'Bx', 'GL261'],
...     label_error_map={'4T1': '4T1-stderr', 'Bx': 'Bx-stderr', 'GL261': 'GL261-stderr'}
... )
classmethod from_csv(filepath: str, input_column: str, id_column: str | None = None, label_columns: List[str] | None = None, label_error_map: Dict[str, str] | None = None, label_error_suffix: str | None = None, weight_columns: List[str] | None = None, mol_input_type: InputType | None = None, metadata: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, reader_kwargs: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, dual_molecule_mode: bool = False, secondary_input_column: str | None = None, secondary_input_type: InputType | None = None, id_factory: Callable[[Dict[str, Any]], Any] | None = None, **mol_kwargs) → MolecularDataset[source]¶

Creates a dataset from a CSV file containing molecular data.

Parameters:

  • filepath – Path to the CSV file

  • input_column – Name of the column containing molecular input data

  • id_column – Optional name of the column to use for molecule IDs

  • label_columns – Optional list of column names to use as labels

  • label_error_map – Optional dictionary mapping label columns to their error columns

  • label_error_suffix – Optional suffix for automatic detection of error columns (e.g., “_error”)

  • weight_columns – Optional list of column names to use as sample weights

  • mol_input_type – Type of molecular input in the input_column (default: SMILES)

  • metadata – Optional dataset-level metadata

  • reader_kwargs – Optional keyword args for pd.read_csv

  • dual_molecule_mode – If True, enables reading both primary and secondary input types

  • secondary_input_column – Column name for secondary molecular input data

  • secondary_input_type – Input type for secondary molecular data

  • id_factory – Optional function to generate unique IDs from row data

  • **mol_kwargs – Additional keyword args passed to Molecule constructor

Returns:

MolecularDataset object

classmethod from_dual_input_csv(filepath: str, smiles_column: str, structure_column: str, structure_type: InputType = InputType.PDB_FILE, id_column: str | None = None, label_columns: List[str] | None = None, label_error_map: Dict[str, str] | None = None, label_error_suffix: str | None = '_error', weight_columns: List[str] | None = None, primary_input: str = 'smiles', metadata: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, reader_kwargs: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, **mol_kwargs) → MolecularDataset[source]¶

Creates a dataset from a CSV file containing both SMILES and structural data.

This is a convenience wrapper around from_csv with dual_molecule_mode=True that makes it simple to handle the common case of having both SMILES and structure files in the same CSV.

Parameters:

  • filepath – Path to the CSV file

  • smiles_column – Name of the column containing SMILES strings

  • structure_column – Name of the column containing structure file paths

  • structure_type – Type of structure files (default: PDB_FILE)

  • id_column – Optional name of the column to use for molecule IDs

  • label_columns – Optional list of column names to use as labels

  • label_error_map – Optional dictionary mapping label columns to their error columns

  • label_error_suffix – Optional suffix for automatic detection of error columns (default: “_error”)

  • weight_columns – Optional list of column names to use as sample weights

  • primary_input – Which input to use as primary (“smiles” or “structure”)

  • metadata – Optional dataset-level metadata

  • reader_kwargs – Optional keyword args for pd.read_csv

  • **mol_kwargs – Additional keyword args passed to Molecule constructor

Returns:

MolecularDataset object

classmethod from_sdf(filepath: str, id_tag: str | None = '_Name', label_tags: List[str] | None = None, label_error_map: Dict[str, str] | None = None, label_error_suffix: str | None = None, weight_tags: List[str] | None = None, include_all_properties: bool = True, mol_obj_kwargs: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, metadata: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, **mol_supplier_kwargs) → MolecularDataset[source]¶

Creates a dataset from an SDF file containing molecular structures and properties.

Parameters:

  • filepath – Path to the SDF file

  • id_tag – SDF tag to use for molecule IDs (default: ‘_Name’)

  • label_tags – Optional list of SDF tags to use as labels

  • label_error_map – Optional dictionary mapping label tags to their error tags

  • label_error_suffix – Optional suffix for automatic detection of error tags (e.g., “_error”)

  • weight_tags – Optional list of SDF tags to use as sample weights

  • include_all_properties – If True, include all SDF tags as molecule properties

  • mol_obj_kwargs – Optional keyword args for Molecule constructor

  • metadata – Optional dataset-level metadata

  • **mol_supplier_kwargs – Additional keyword args for RDKit’s SDMolSupplier

Returns:

MolecularDataset object

filter_by_error(label_name: str, max_error: float, error_suffix: str | None = '-stderr', error_column: str | None = None, drop_na: bool = True, inplace: bool = False) → MolecularDataset | None[source]¶

Filter dataset to keep only molecules where the error for a specific label is below a cutoff.

Parameters:

  • label_name – Name of the label to filter by

  • max_error – Maximum allowed error value (exclusive)

  • error_suffix – Suffix to automatically detect error column (default: ‘-stderr’)

  • error_column – Explicit name of error column (overrides suffix detection)

  • drop_na – Whether to drop molecules with NaN error values (default: True)

  • inplace – If True, modify this dataset in place. If False, return new dataset.

Returns:

Filtered MolecularDataset if inplace=False, None if inplace=True

Examples

>>> # Filter Bx data to keep only points with error < 10
>>> filtered_dataset = dataset.filter_by_error('Bx', 10.0)

>>> # Filter in place
>>> dataset.filter_by_error('Bx', 10.0, inplace=True)

>>> # Use custom error column name
>>> filtered_dataset = dataset.filter_by_error('Bx', 10.0, error_column='Bx_uncertainty')
filter_by_label_range(label_name: str, min_value: float | None = None, max_value: float | None = None, drop_na: bool = True, inplace: bool = False) → MolecularDataset | None[source]¶

Filter dataset to keep only molecules where a label value is within a specified range.

Parameters:

  • label_name – Name of the label to filter by

  • min_value – Minimum allowed value (inclusive). If None, no lower bound.

  • max_value – Maximum allowed value (inclusive). If None, no upper bound.

  • drop_na – Whether to drop molecules with NaN label values (default: True)

  • inplace – If True, modify this dataset in place. If False, return new dataset.

Returns:

Filtered MolecularDataset if inplace=False, None if inplace=True

Examples

>>> # Keep only molecules with Bx between 50 and 100
>>> filtered_dataset = dataset.filter_by_label_range('Bx', 50.0, 100.0)

>>> # Keep only molecules with Bx >= 75
>>> filtered_dataset = dataset.filter_by_label_range('Bx', min_value=75.0)

>>> # Keep only molecules with Bx <= 90
>>> filtered_dataset = dataset.filter_by_label_range('Bx', max_value=90.0)
filter_by_mask(mask: Series | ndarray | List[bool], inplace: bool = False) → MolecularDataset | None[source]¶

Filter dataset using a custom boolean mask.

Parameters:

  • mask – Boolean mask with same length as dataset

  • inplace – If True, modify this dataset in place. If False, return new dataset.

Returns:

Filtered MolecularDataset if inplace=False, None if inplace=True

Examples

>>> # Custom complex filter
>>> mask = (dataset.get_labels(['Bx'])['Bx'] > 50) & (dataset.get_labels(['4T1'])['4T1'] < 80)
>>> filtered_dataset = dataset.filter_by_mask(mask)
get_dataset_hash() → str[source]¶

Generate a unique hash for this dataset based on molecular content.

This hash is used as the dataset identifier for caching representations. It’s based on the SMILES strings (or other identifiers) of all molecules.

Returns:

SHA-256 hash of dataset content

Return type:

str

get_cache_instance()[source]¶

Get the global cache instance for this dataset.

has_cached_representation(representation_name: str, featurizer_params: dict | None = None) → bool[source]¶

Check if a representation is already cached for this dataset.

Parameters:

  • representation_name – Name of the representation

  • featurizer_params – Optional featurizer parameters

Returns:

True if cached representation exists

Return type:

bool

load_cached_representation(representation_name: str, featurizer_params: dict | None = None)[source]¶

Load a cached representation for this dataset.

Parameters:

  • representation_name – Name of the representation

  • featurizer_params – Optional featurizer parameters

Returns:

Tuple of (data, metadata) if found, None otherwise

cache_representation(representation_name: str, data, featurizer_params: dict | None = None, metadata: dict | None = None) → bool[source]¶

Cache a computed representation for this dataset.

Parameters:

  • representation_name – Name of the representation

  • data – The computed representation data (numpy array, dataframe, etc.)

  • featurizer_params – Optional featurizer parameters

  • metadata – Optional additional metadata

Returns:

True if successfully cached

Return type:

bool

clear_cache(representation_name: str | None = None)[source]¶

Clear cached representations for this dataset.

Parameters:

representation_name – Specific representation to clear, or None to clear all

Functions for generating overview reports and statistics for MolecularDatasets.

polyglotmol.data.overview.generate_dataset_report(dataset: Any, report_format: str = 'dict', properties_to_analyze: List[str] | None = None, max_similarity_matrix: int = 1000, n_sample_structures: int = 12, plot_backend: str = 'matplotlib') → Dict | str[source]¶

Generates an overview report for a MolecularDataset. Includes basic stats, validity, property distributions, MW, diversity, and sample structures.
